title: Instant Pot Coq au Vin
description: This recipe has been modified to cook really tough roosters that have been running around the yard their whole lives. Normal cooking methods make them too tough to eat. If you want to cook a regular chicken, pressure cook it for 20 minutes instead of 90.
directions: Select Saute on instant pot. Add olive oil. Dice Bacon and cook until just crisp. Drain on paper towel.
Add chopped onion to drippings and cook, stirring for about 2 minutes, or until onion is softened. Remove onion to plate.
Pat chicken dry, lightly season with salt and pepper. Add half the chicken to pot and cook 6-7 minutes or until browned on both sides. remove to the onion plate, repeat with the rest.

Combine red wine, chicken stock, and tomato paste in Insta-pot and cook for a minute or two, scraping up browned bits. Add bacon onion, chicken, garlic, carrots, and mushrooms. Add thyme and bay leaves. Cancel saute.
Secure lid and pressure cook for 90 minutes.
Take out chicken and vegetables to bowl and keep warm.
Combine flour with softened butter and mix for a smooth paste. Stir to simmer liquids. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Pour sauce over chicken and vegetables, garnish, and serve.
